channel.title: math.GR updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GR updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On Wiegold's conjecture for the small Ree groups
item.description: arXiv:2510.06479v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The Wiegold conjecture holds for the small Ree groups for $k$-tuples where $k \geq 5$.
item.dc:creator: Sira Busch, Mark Pengitore, Jeroen Schillewaert, Hendrik Van Maldeghem

item.title: Limit varieties of aperiodic monoids
item.description: arXiv:2510.06854v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A limit variety is a variety that is minimal with respect to being non-finitely based. We present a new limit variety of aperiodic monoid. We also show that if there exists any other limit variety of aperiodic monoids, then it is contained in the joint of the variety $\mathbb B^1$ of all idempotent monoids and certain finitely generated variety $\mathbb E^1$ with $\mathbb B^1 \wedge \mathbb E^1 = \mathbb L_2^1$, where $\mathbb L_2^1$ is the variety of left-zero monoids. Jackson and Lee proved that $\mathbb E^1$ is HFB, that is, its every subvariety is finitely based. We exend this result a step up the classical decomposition $\mathbb B^1=\bigcup_{i \ge 2} \mathbb L^1_i$ by showing that $\mathbb E^1 \vee \overline{\mathbb E^1} \vee \mathbb L^1_3$ is also HFB, where $\overline{\mathbb E^1}$ is the variety dual of $\mathbb E^1$.
item.dc:creator: Sergey V. Gusev, Olga B. Sapir

item.title: Vertex-reversing maps and almost Sylow-cyclic groups
item.description: arXiv:2510.07033v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A map is \emph{vertex-reversing} if it admits an arc-transitive automorphism group with dihedral vertex stabilizers. This paper classifies solvable vertex-reversing maps whose edge number and Euler characteristic are coprime. The classification establishes that such maps comprise three families: dihedral maps, cyclic covers of dihedral maps, and cyclic covers of $S_4$-maps. Our classification based on an explicit characterization of finite almost Sylow-cyclic groups. While Conder--Potocnik--\v{S}iran provided a classification for groups acting regularly on maps in \cite[Theorem~4.1]{reg-ASCAuto}, this work delivers a shorter proof with explicitly constructed generators and relations for all such groups.
item.dc:creator: Cai Heng Li, Luyi Liu, Hanyue Yi

item.title: Phase transition for recurrence of stationary random walks on lamplighter groups
item.description: arXiv:2510.06441v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We introduce and study a class of random walks on lamplighter groups $H\wr G$, where $H$ is a nontrivial finitely generated group and $G$ is an infinite finitely generated group, called \textbf{stationary random walks}. At each step, the walk switches the lamp at its current position, moves in the base group with a drift towards the identity, and switches the lamp again at the new position. We show that when $G$ is virtually-$\mathbb{Z}$ and $H$ is finite, these walks exhibit a phase transition between recurrence and transience, while when~$G$ is not virtually-$\mathbb{Z}$ or $H$ is infinite, they are always transient. In the case $G=\mathbb{Z}$, we determine the exact critical parameter and provide a quantitative description of this phase transition.
item.dc:creator: Itai Benjamini, Guy Blachar, Ariel Yadin

item.title: Whitehead doubling, rank estimate and nonembeddability of contractible open manifolds
item.description: arXiv:2510.06598v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Let $K$ be a nontrivial knot. For each $n\in \mathbb{N}$, we prove that the rank of its $n$th iterated Whitehead doubled knot group $\pi_1(S^3 \setminus \operatorname{WD}^n(K))$ is bounded below by $n+1$. As an application, we show that there exist infinitely many non-homeomorphic contractible open $n$-manifolds ($n\geq 3$) which cannot embed in a compact, locally connected and locally 1-connected $n$-dimensional metric space.
item.dc:creator: Shijie Gu, Jian Wang, Yanqing Zou

item.title: Integrable measure equivalence rigidity of right-angled Artin groups via quasi-isometry
item.description: arXiv:2309.12147v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $G$ be a right-angled Artin group with $|\mathrm{Out}(G)|<+\infty$. We prove that if a countable group $H$ with bounded torsion is measure equivalent to $G$, with an $L^1$-integrable measure equivalence cocycle towards $G$, then $H$ is finitely generated and quasi-isometric to $G$. In particular, through work of Kleiner and the second-named author, $H$ acts properly and cocompactly on a $\mathrm{CAT}(0)$ cube complex which is quasi-isometric to $G$ and equivariantly projects to the right-angled building of $G$. As a consequence of work of the second-named author, we derive a superrigidity theorem in integrable measure equivalence for an infinite class of right-angled Artin groups, including those whose defining graph is an $n$-gon with $n\ge 5$. In contrast, we also prove that if a right-angled Artin group $G$ with $|\mathrm{Out}(G)|<+\infty$ splits non-trivially as a product, then there does not exist any locally compact group which contains all groups $H$ that are $L^1$-measure equivalent to $G$ as lattices, even up to replacing $H$ by a finite-index subgroup and taking the quotient by a finite normal subgroup.
item.dc:creator: Camille Horbez, Jingyin Huang

item.title: Normal Subgroup Theorem for groups acting on $\tilde A_2$-buildings
item.description: arXiv:2310.13472v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $\Gamma$ be a group acting on with finite stabilizers and finite fundamental domain on a building of type $\tilde A_2$. We prove that any non-trivial normal subgroup of $\Gamma$ is of finite index in $\Gamma$.
item.dc:creator: Uri Bader, Alex Furman, Jean L\'ecureux

item.title: z-Classes in Finite Coxeter Groups
item.description: arXiv:2401.05178v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we give the enumeration of z-classes in finite Coxeter groups.
item.dc:creator: Dilpreet Kaur, Uday Bhaskar Sharma

item.title: Finite Simple Groups in the Primitive Positive Constructability Poset
item.description: arXiv:2409.06487v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that any clone over a finite domain that has a quasi Maltsev operation and fully symmetric operations of all arities has an incoming minion homomorphism from I, the clone of all idempotent operations on a two element set. We use this result to show that in the pp-constructability poset the lower covers of the structure with all relations that are invariant under I are the transitive tournament on three vertices and structures in one-to-one correspondence with all finite simple groups.
item.dc:creator: Sebastian Meyer, Florian Starke

item.title: On the resolvent degree of PSU(3,q)
item.description: arXiv:2509.19237v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Resolvent degree ($\operatorname{RD}$) is an invariant of finite groups in terms of the complexity of their algebraic actions. We address the problem of bounding $\operatorname{RD}(G)$ for all finite simple groups using the methods established by G\'{o}mez-Gonz\'{a}les-Sutherland-Wolfson in terms of $\operatorname{RD}^{\leq d}_{\mathbb{C}}$-versality and special points. We give upper bounds on $\operatorname{RD}(\operatorname{PSU}(3,q))$ and $\operatorname{RD}(\operatorname{PSU}(2, q))$ in terms of classical invariant theory. In the $\operatorname{PSU}(3,q)$ case, stability of low-degree invariants permit an asymptotic bound on $\operatorname{RD}$ growing in $q$.
item.dc:creator: Pablo Nicolas Christofferson, Akash Ganguly, Claudio Gomez-Gonzales, Ella Kuriyama, Yihan Carmen Li, Nawal Baydoun

item.title: Canonical Reduction Systems in Artin-Tits groups of spherical type
item.description: arXiv:2510.00713v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We introduce the canonical reduction system of an element in an Artin-Tits group of spherical type, which generalizes the similar notion for braids (and mapping classes) introduced by Birman, Lubotzky and McCarthy. We show its basic properties, which coincide with those satisfied in braid groups, and we provide an algorithm to compute it. We improve the algorithm in the case of braid groups, and discuss its complexity in this case. As a necessary result for obtaining the general algorithm, we prove that the centralizers of positive powers of an element form a periodic sequence and we show how to compute its period.
item.dc:creator: Mar\'ia Cumplido, Juan Gonz\'alez-Meneses, Davide Perego

item.title: Automorphic orbits in free groups: recent progress
item.description: arXiv:2510.00889v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this survey, we describe recent progress on asymptotic properties of various automorphic orbits in free groups. In particular, we address the problem of counting potentially positive elements of a given length. We also discuss complexity (worst-case, average-case, and generic-case) of Whitehead's automorphism problem and relevant properties of automorphic orbits, including orbit-blocking words.
item.dc:creator: Vladimir Shpilrain

item.title: Breaking the cubic barrier in the Solovay-Kitaev algorithm
item.description: arXiv:2306.13158v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We improve the Solovay--Kitaev theorem and algorithm for a general finite, inverse-closed generating set acting on a qudit. Prior versions of the algorithm efficiently find a word of length $O(n^{3+\delta})$ to approximate an arbitrary target gate to $n$ bits of precision. Using two new ideas, each of which reduces the exponent separately, our new bound on the word length is $O(n^{1.44042\ldots+\delta})$. Our result holds more generally for any finite set that densely generates any connected, semisimple real Lie group, with an extra length term in the noncompact case to reach group elements far away from the identity.
item.dc:creator: Greg Kuperberg (UC Davis)

item.title: Description of the structure of DG--algebras via characters on a groupoid
item.description: arXiv:2503.21784v5 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We construct a description of graded derivations in group algebras. Using this result for arbitrary graduation of the group algebra, we describe all possible structures of DG algebras. The corresponding examples are given. The description is given in terms of characters on a groupoid analogous to the groupoid of inner action.
item.dc:creator: Andronick Arutyunov, Oleg Muravev

item.title: Dehn fillings, equivariant homology, and the Baum-Connes conjecture
item.description: arXiv:2509.15070v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We establish a connection between Cohen-Lyndon triples and equivariant homology theory, with a focus on the Baum-Connes conjecture. In the first part of this work, we establish an excision sequence for the classifying spaces for proper actions in equivariant homology theories. This provides a direct link between Cohen-Lyndon triples and the left-hand side of the Baum-Connes conjecture. Independently of these, we prove that the Baum-Connes conjecture with coefficients (BCC) with finite wreath products holds for all discrete hyperbolic groups, building on the monumental work of Lafforgue. Combining this with permanence properties and the work of Dahmani-Guirardel-Osin on relatively hyperbolic groups, we identify a broad class of groups, including all lattices in simple Lie groups of real rank one that satisfy the BCC with finite wreath products. This significantly broadens the scope of our first result, as Cohen-Lyndon triples arise naturally in the context of relatively hyperbolic groups, thereby connecting both sides of the Baum-Connes conjecture.
item.dc:creator: Shintaro Nishikawa, Nansen Petrosyan

item.title: On distributional topological complexity of groups and manifolds
item.description: arXiv:2509.16759v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove the equality $\dTC(\Gamma)=\TC(\Gamma)$ for distributional topological complexity of torsion free hyperbolic and of torsion free nilpotent groups. For the distributional topological complexity of lens spaces we prove the inequality $\dTC(L^n_p)\le 2p-1$ and for the distributional LS-category the inequality $d\cat(L^n_p)\le p-1$ which turns into equality for prime $p$ and $n>p$. We use these inequalities to bring counter-examples to the product formula for $d\cat$ and $\dTC$.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Dranishnikov

item.title: Spectral gap for the signed interchange process with arbitrary sets
item.description: arXiv:2510.04244v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In 2020, F. Cesi introduced a random walk on the hyperoctahedral group $B_n$ and analysed its spectral gap when the allowed generators are transpositions and diagonal elements corresponding to singletons. In this paper we extend the allowed generators to transpositions and any diagonal elements, and characterise completely the set of representations from which the spectral gap arises. This settles a conjecture posed in Cesi's paper.
item.dc:creator: Gil Alon, Subhajit Ghosh
